thread.title: NBA-Timberwolves coach Saunders dies at age 60
thread.title_full: NBA-Timberwolves coach Saunders dies at age 60

title: NBA-Timberwolves coach Saunders dies at age 60
text:
NBA-Timberwolves coach Saunders dies at age 60 
CCTV.com Share this: Share on twitter Share on facebook Share on sinaweibo Share on email Font size: 
The new NBA season tips off on Tuesday evening, but it will be doing so without one of it's better known figures roaming the sidelines, as Flip Saunders, the Minnesota Timberwolves president of basketball operations and head coach has died at the age of 60, following a battle with cancer. Beloved NBA bench boss passes away after battle with cancer 
The team made the sad announcement after Saunders, a veteran of 17 NBA seasons, who posted a career record of 654 wins and 592 losses, was diagnosed with Hodgkins Lymphoma, a cancer of the immune system, in June. 
The longtime coach said in August when the team announced his health issues, that doctors called his condition a very treatable and curable form of the disease. He took a leave of absence from in September, after complications arose following chemotherapy treatments. 
Saunders coached the Timberwolves for 11 seasons in two separate stints. He also led the Detroit Pistons and Washington Wizards. He began his NBA coaching career in 1996 with the Timberwolves, and guided the team to eight playoff appearances in a row. Related Videos
